history.content:
I'm (hoping) to get a CS minor and I've been making my schedule with this caveat from the minor homepage in mind--

"How do I get into classes?

At this time, minors do not receive priority for getting into classes. That being said, many minors do get into classes; they just have to be flexible, patient, or enroll in summer session. 

Courses that some minors have had success getting into include CS 164, CS 184, and to some extent, CS 170 and CS 188 (depending on demand)"

So I try to put these classes to the forefront of my planning, and try to follow the enrollment patterns from Berkeleytime for the ones that aren't listed, and just try to min/max what courses are feasible for me, my remaining semesters, what can I knock out in the summers, and the draft schedule. It's not an ideal answer, but it's likely that since we don't have enrollment priority, we can just phase 1 and hope for the best, or stick with classes and see if people drop, or just accept that we won't be able to use the super popular/smaller classes/things that typically don't get expanded to complete our minors :/

Since you're trying for EECS, I would imagine the upper div caveat is somewhat identical, but if there are EE specific classes you're interested in, it might be worthwhile to check out their enrollment history on Berkeleytime or poke around piazza with a search for 'phase 1' and see if there are any trends you can find on which EE classes are more likely to have open seats for students that don't fit into any of the reserved categories.

good luck~

The student answer is good.  There are also other warnings on the minor homepage. See https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/minor 

Unfortunately, nothing has changed since those cautions were written. 160 is less likely to be worth spending units on waitlisting since it is a small class that has high popularity.

Also see https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy and https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/getting-into-ee-classes

I'm looking at the list of EECS Classes for Fa20 and everything I'm interested in has all seats reserved for "Electrical Engineering and Computer Sciences (EECS), EECS/Nuclear Engineering, EECS/Materials Science and Engineering, or Computer Science Majors". I'm looking at, among others, 160 (which is already really hard to get into bc of the low seat count, I get that), 161, 168, 186.

How can I get into these and complete my minor if everything is reserved?
history.subject: How do EECS Minors get into CS Classes?
